title: State Synchronization with localStorage & sessionStorage
content:
Definition:
State synchronization means storing state values in browser storage so that they persist even after refresh. localStorage stores data permanently; sessionStorage stores data only per session.

Use:
Used for saving cart items, login tokens, preferences, recent searches, or form progress.

Importance:
Prevents users from losing data on refresh and improves user experience. It also reduces the number of API calls required.

Major Use & Advantages:
Enhances persistence, reliability, and offline capability.
examples: Store last visited page or filters
